p: Our findings do not necessarily contradict the rodent-to-human route of LASV transmission, which is supported by recent LASV phylogenies based on sequences mostly sampled from humans [ 8, 9, 10]. Instead, we call for a broader paradigm including infection in the reverse direction. In such a scenario, few infectious humans could initiate a LASV focus area, which is then perpetuated by commensal rodents acting as transmission enhancers.
